definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: No investigation, no right to speak.
sentences.chinese: 沒有調查就沒有發言權。

sentences.english: Smart people say dumb stuff when faced with someone else's pregnancy.
sentences.chinese: 瀟灑的人說面臨某人懷孕時沒有發言權。

sentences.english: All countries must have a voice in how resources are deployed and managed.
sentences.chinese: 在資源的分配和管理問題上，每個國家都要有發言權。

sentences.english: This means village committees, mostly controlled by party appointees, will surely retain considerable say over any land deals.
sentences.chinese: 這意味着村委會對任何土地交易有相當大的發言權。

sentences.english: The trade union representative wants a voice in management decisions.
sentences.chinese: 工會代表要求在管理決策上有發言權。

sentences.english: The member for Brigton has the floor.
sentences.chinese: 代表布賴頓市的議員在議會上有發言權。

sentences.english: They contested his right to speak.
sentences.chinese: 他們對他的發言權提出了質疑。

sentences.english: They didn't have any say in where they wanted to be.
The voice of Showhand is less here.
sentences.chinese: 梭哈在這裏的發言權要少許多。

sentences.english: But we have to find our own voices.
sentences.chinese: 但是我們要找到自己的發言權。

sentences.english: I still insist that without investigation there cannot possibly be any right to speak.
sentences.chinese: 不但不悔，我仍然堅持沒有調查是不可能有發言權的。

sentences.english: The Afghan people should have the final say on their future government.
sentences.chinese: 阿人民應該對自己的未來政權安排擁有最終的發言權。

sentences.english: Consultative parties and associated organisations shall have the right to speak but not to vote.
sentences.chinese: 各諮議黨與合作組織有發言權，但不參與投票表決。

sentences.english: He also pledged to give the younger generation a voice.
sentences.chinese: 他還表示決心要給年輕一代發言權。

sentences.english: The workpeople had no say in how their factory was run.
sentences.chinese: 工人們在工廠管理方面沒有發言權。

sentences.english: These are the geo-political entities who may have some claim to moral integrity and authenticity.
sentences.chinese: 這些地緣政治實體在道德正義方面有發言權。

definition: frightening words to scare people (idiom); alarmist talk/reds under the beds
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
to gesticulate/to point out/to point the finger of blame
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
lit. heaven's law and earth's principle (idiom); fig. right and proper/right and unalterable/a matter of course
to view sb as an enemy/to be hateful towards
